Docs.summary: The NumericShaper class is used to convert Latin-1 (European) digits to other Unicode decimal digits.

remarks.para: The NumericShaper class is used to convert Latin-1 (European) digits to other Unicode decimal digits. Users of this class will primarily be people who wish to present data using national digit shapes, but find it more convenient to represent the data internally using Latin-1 (European) digits. This does not interpret the deprecated numeric shape selector character (U+206E).

Instances of NumericShaper are typically applied as attributes to text with the TextAttribute#NUMERIC_SHAPING NUMERIC_SHAPING attribute of the TextAttribute class. For example, this code snippet causes a TextLayout to shape European digits to Arabic in an Arabic context:
It is also possible to perform numeric shaping explicitly using instances of NumericShaper, as this code snippet demonstrates:
Bit mask- and enum-based Unicode ranges

This class supports two different programming interfaces to represent Unicode ranges for script-specific digits: bit mask-based ones, such as #ARABIC NumericShaper.ARABIC, and enum-based ones, such as NumericShaper.Range#ARABIC. Multiple ranges can be specified by ORing bit mask-based constants, such as: <blockquote>
or creating a Set with the NumericShaper.Range constants, such as:
The enum-based ranges are a super set of the bit mask-based ones.

If the two interfaces are mixed (including serialization), Unicode range values are mapped to their counterparts where such mapping is possible, such as NumericShaper.Range.ARABIC from/to NumericShaper.ARABIC. If any unmappable range values are specified, such as NumericShaper.Range.BALINESE, those ranges are ignored.
Decimal Digits Precedence

A Unicode range may have more than one set of decimal digits. If multiple decimal digits sets are specified for the same Unicode range, one of the sets will take precedence as follows.
Unicode Range NumericShaper Constants Precedence
Arabic NumericShaper#ARABIC NumericShaper.ARABIC
NumericShaper#EASTERN_ARABIC NumericShaper.EASTERN_ARABIC		 NumericShaper#EASTERN_ARABIC NumericShaper.EASTERN_ARABIC
NumericShaper.Range#ARABIC
NumericShaper.Range#EASTERN_ARABIC		 NumericShaper.Range#EASTERN_ARABIC
Tai Tham NumericShaper.Range#TAI_THAM_HORA
NumericShaper.Range#TAI_THAM_THAM		 NumericShaper.Range#TAI_THAM_THAM
Added in 1.4.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created andÂ shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared Function GetContextualShaper (ranges As Ranges) As NumericShaper
.method public static hidebysig class Java.Awt.Font.NumericShaper GetContextualShaper(valuetype Java.Awt.Font.Ranges ranges) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a contextual shaper for the provided unicode range(s).
Docs.returns: a shaper for the specified ranges

remarks.para: Returns a contextual shaper for the provided unicode range(s). Latin-1 (EUROPEAN) digits are converted to the decimal digits corresponding to the range of the preceding text, if the range is one of the provided ranges. Multiple ranges are represented by or-ing the values together, such as, NumericShaper.ARABIC | NumericShaper.THAI. The shaper assumes EUROPEAN as the starting context, that is, if EUROPEAN digits are encountered before any strong directional text in the string, the context is presumed to be EUROPEAN, and so the digits will not shape.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created andÂ shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

static member GetContextualShaper : Java.Awt.Font.Ranges * int -> Java.Awt.Font.NumericShaper

Docs.param: the starting context, such as NumericShaper.EUROPEAN
Docs.summary: Returns a contextual shaper for the provided unicode range(s).
Docs.returns: a shaper for the specified Unicode ranges.

remarks.para: Returns a contextual shaper for the provided unicode range(s). Latin-1 (EUROPEAN) digits will be converted to the decimal digits corresponding to the range of the preceding text, if the range is one of the provided ranges. Multiple ranges are represented by or-ing the values together, for example, NumericShaper.ARABIC | NumericShaper.THAI. The shaper uses defaultContext as the starting context.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created andÂ shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Ranges As Ranges
public: property Java::Awt::Font::Ranges Ranges { Java::Awt::Font::Ranges get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns an int that ORs together the values for all the ranges that will be shaped.
Docs.value: the values for all the ranges to be shaped.

remarks.para: Returns an int that ORs together the values for all the ranges that will be shaped.

For example, to check if a shaper shapes to Arabic, you would use the following:
if ((shaper.getRanges() & shaper.ARABIC) != 0) { ...
Note that this method supports only the bit mask-based ranges. Call #getRangeSet() for the enum-based ranges.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created andÂ shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Returns a Set representing all the Unicode ranges in this NumericShaper that will be shaped.

remarks.para: Returns a Set representing all the Unicode ranges in this NumericShaper that will be shaped.

Docs.summary: Converts the digits in the text that occur between start and start + count, using the provided context.
